18#include <sys/cdefs.h>
19__RCSID("$NetBSD: threads.c,v 1.1.1.6 2018/02/06 01:53:08 christos Exp $");
20
21#include "portable.h"
22
23#include <stdio.h>
24
25#include <ac/stdarg.h>
26#include <ac/stdlib.h>
27#include <ac/string.h>
28#include <ac/unistd.h>
29
30#include "ldap_pvt_thread.h" /* Get the thread interface */
31#include "ldap_thr_debug.h" /* May redirect thread initialize/destroy calls */
32
33
34/*
35 * Common LDAP thread routines
36 * see thr_*.c for implementation specific routines
37 * see rdwr.c for generic reader/writer lock implementation
38 * see tpool.c for generic thread pool implementation
39 */
40
41
42int ldap_pvt_thread_initialize( void )
43{
44 int rc;
45 static int init = 0;
46 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_t rm;
47 ldap_pvt_thread_t tid;
48
49 /* we only get one shot at this */
50 if( init++ ) return -1;
51
52 rc = ldap_int_thread_initialize();
53 if( rc ) return rc;
54
55#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_TPOOL
56 rc = ldap_int_thread_pool_startup();
57 if( rc ) return rc;
58#endif
59
60 /* kludge to pull symbol definitions in */
61 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_init( &rm );
62 tid = ldap_pvt_thread_self();
63 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_lock( &rm, tid );
64 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_trylock( &rm, tid );
65 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_unlock( &rm, tid );
66 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_unlock( &rm, tid );
67 ldap_pvt_thread_rmutex_destroy( &rm );
68
69 return 0;
70}
71
72int ldap_pvt_thread_destroy( void )
73{
74#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_TPOOL
75 (void) ldap_int_thread_pool_shutdown();
76#endif
77 return ldap_int_thread_destroy();
78}
79
80
81/*
82 * Default implementations of some LDAP thread routines
83 */
84
85#define LDAP_THREAD_IMPLEMENTATION
86#include "ldap_thr_debug.h" /* May rename the symbols defined below */
87
88
89#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_GETCONCURRENCY
90int
91ldap_pvt_thread_get_concurrency ( void )
92{
93 return 1;
94}
95#endif
96
97#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_SETCONCURRENCY
98int
99ldap_pvt_thread_set_concurrency ( int concurrency )
100{
101 return 1;
102}
103#endif
104
105#ifndef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_SLEEP
106/*
107 * Here we assume we have fully preemptive threads and that sleep()
108 * does the right thing.
109 */
110unsigned int
111ldap_pvt_thread_sleep(
112 unsigned int interval
113)
114{
115 sleep( interval );
116 return 0;
117}
118#endif
